meanings.definition: The speech habits peculiar to a particular person.
meanings.sent1: Her idiolect includes unique phrases and pronunciations.
meanings.sent2: He could identify his friend just by listening to their idiolect.
meanings.sent3: In her idiolect, she always says 'y'all' instead of 'you all'.
meanings.sent4: His idiolect is a colorful tapestry of words and accents.
meanings.sent5: The idiolect of the old man was a blend of nostalgia and wisdom.

meanings.definition: The distinctive speech of an individual.
meanings.sent1: Each person has their own idiolect that sets them apart.
meanings.sent2: The idiolect of the actor made every character unique.
meanings.sent3: The parrot mimicked the idiolect of its owner, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her idiolect was a symphony of words that resonated with everyone.
meanings.sent5: The idiolect of the poet painted vivid pictures with every word.
